description: Vultures are scavenging birds of prey that play vital roles in ecosystems by consuming carrion.
They are adapted to locate carcasses and often soar using thermals.
Vipers are a family of venomous snakes with long hinged fangs used to inject venom into prey.
They inhabit a variety of habitats and feed on mammals, birds and other vertebrates.
The vicuna is a wild South American camelid valued for fine wool, found in high-altitude grasslands.
They graze on highland vegetation and live in family groups.
The vaquita is a critically endangered porpoise endemic to the northern Gulf of California.
It is a small cetacean threatened by bycatch and habitat pressures.
Vervet monkeys are medium-sized Old World monkeys common in sub-Saharan Africa, highly social and adaptable.
They feed on fruit, leaves, seeds and small animals.
